tasks.task: Tilling the soil in a farm field
subtasks: Approach the farming equipment storage area
Retrieve the tiller or plow from the storage
Transport the tiller or plow to the farm field
Secure the tiller or plow onto the tractor
Drive the tractor to the designated area of the farm field
Start the tractor and attach the tiller or plow to the front of the tractor
Lower the tiller or plow into the soil
Operate the tractor with the tiller or plow to cultivate the soil
Monitor the depth and coverage of the soil cultivation
Prepare the seed planting machine or seed drill
Fill the seed planting machine with seeds
Position the machine along the rows of the cultivated field
Operate the seed planting machine, ensuring proper spacing and depth
Adjust the machine as necessary to handle different soil conditions or seed requirements
Select the appropriate type and amount of fertilizer based on crop needs
Load the fertilizer into a spreader or broadcast applicator
Attach the spreader to the agricultural tractor or hitches to the rear of the tractor
Drive the tractor along the rows, operating the spreader to distribute the fertilizer evenly
Monitor wind direction and speed to prevent drift, adjusting the applicator settings accordingly
Choose the right herbicide formulation for the specific crops and weeds
Transfer the herbicide from the container to the sprayer tank
Connect the spray hoses and boom to the sprayer unit
Calibrate the sprayer to deliver the correct application rate and pattern
Drive the sprayer rig through the field,-monitoring coverage to ensure thorough weed control
Unload harvested crops, such as grain or grain silage, from transport vehicles
Load the crops into the threshing machine or combine harvester
Operate the combine's cutter bar to cut the crops as they enter the machine
Use the sieves and fans inside the combine to separate the grain from the chaff and straw
Direct the grain into the storage bin and the chaff and straw onto the field or into a bale net for later use

tasks.task: Conducting routine maintenance on the machinery
subtasks: Inspect tractors, tillers, and other equipment for wear and tear
Grease or service moving parts as necessary
Check fluid levels (oil, coolant, hydraulic, etc.) and top up or change as needed
Lubricate all moving parts and check for any loose connections or bolts
Clean dirty parts or replace damaged components
Test all safety features and operator controls to ensure they function properly
